item.description:
Hi Everyone,

For the September meetup, I thought we would bring back a really fun/educational/social event from the past. 

On September 24th, from 6:30 to 9:30 come and enjoy a fun social wine and cheese event and in addition watch some really talented artists sculpt, mold, and blow what was once a pile of sand, or something like that, into vases, crystal, jewelry etc. 

Cheese, crackers, and meats will be served in their lounge, along with a selection of unique and delicious wines.  

This is a mixed group social event, so space is allocated on a first come first serve up to their limit of 60.  At the moment they have 40 spots remaining for this date.

For those interested, please register on their web site and try to pay the $35 cost up front, and then RSVP the meetup site. This will ensure Diablo doesn't lose people from last minute cancellations, and it gives me a solid count of Canucks serious about attending. So please do not register with Diablo or RSVP our site until you know for sure.

http://www.diabloglassschool.com/wineandcheese.htm

Afterwards if there is interest we can head back into town and maybe grab a bite at Jacob Wirth's.

http://www.jacobwirth.com/index.html

The Roxbury Crossing T stop is the closest subway station for those using public transit.

Cheers,

Bruce

group.name: The Boston Expat Canadian Meetup Group

item.name: Glass Blowing Wine & Cheese Event!
